intro: Escobaria muehlbaueriana, commonly known as Muehlbauer's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and fleshy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple during the spring and early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Escobaria muehlbaueriana is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental appeal.
